alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Garfield; Kingfisher; Lincoln; Logan; McClain; Oklahoma; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 3:10AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Kingfisher, northern Grady, northeastern Caddo, Oklahoma, western Lincoln, southern Blaine, Logan, Canadian, northwestern McClain, southern Noble, northwestern Cleveland, Payne and eastern Garfield Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 309 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Perry to near Edmond to 6 miles east of Binger. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, western Norman, Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Enid, Stillwater, Del City, El Reno, Chickasha, Guthrie, Newcastle, Blanchard, Perry, Watonga, Kingfisher, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, and Choctaw. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 111 and 195. Interstate 40 between mile markers 93 and 168. Interstate 44 between mile markers 78 and 163. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Cleveland; Garfield; Kingfisher; Lincoln; Logan; McClain; Oklahoma; Payne
